Company Name Woolworths Supermarkets Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 56 minutes ago Number of views 1 view

Job description

Duty Manager - Woolworths Eltham

As the day ends, you take the reins, managing the store until close and motivating the hardworking Night Fill Team to replenish the shelves
Woolworths, a job is never just a job.

It’s the start of something bigger. There are over 128,000 of us, in the biggest cities and the tiniest towns. And each of us have an important role to play. If you have a passion for great customer service, a hunger to make a tangible difference and you’re looking for a place to develop, you could be who we’re looking for.
Who we are

Joining Woolworths Supermarkets means being a part of the the wider Woolworths Group, which includes the businesses of BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Big W, Cellarmasters, ALH Group and Countdown (NZ). Which means you won’t have one opportunity with us, you’ll have thousands.
Why work with us
Whether you’re starting out, already on the way to achieving your goals or at the top of your game, we can help you build a brilliant retail career- If you’ve got goals, we’ve got all you need to succeed. You’ll find over a thousand career options, plus the learning encouragement and support for you to grow. We’re a team that is there for each other. By working alongside people you can learn from, you’ll grow and develop in a fun, supportive environment. Working with a diverse range of people in an industry facing rapid change, you’ll gain real-world experience and grow as a person. Whether it’s making customers smile, supporting Aussie farmers, or playing an important role in your local community, you’ll be doing a little good every day at Woolworths.
When you will be needed
This is a part time EBA (16 hours per week) which will require the successful candidate to work rotating roster which will include weekends, evenings, early and late shifts as required.
What makes you right for Woolies

The right attitude is everything....
  • Genuine passion for food & shopping
  • Customer first mentality
  • Love of teamwork and growing with others
  • Flexible and adaptable to change
  • Willing to work and reliable

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago Number of views 2 views

Job description

Madison Branson Lawyers is a full-service boutique law firm, known for delivering high-quality legal advice in an easy to understand manner. Our team consists of specalised practitioners, who think beyond the law and integrate practical business knowledge and experience to deliver tailored and sophisticated legal advice. This approach has led the firm to experience rapid growth, welcoming the newly created opportunity for a commercial/property lawyer to join our team.


Position Description

We are looking for an experienced commercial/property lawyer with 4+ years PAE to join our team. Experience in commercial and corporation law and/or a background in practical business or commerce roles will be viewed favorably but is not essential.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:\xa0


Drafting, reviewing and advising on agreements (general corporate, commercial, service agreements);

  • Drafting, reviewing and advising on business terms and conditions and online terms of use;

  • Buy/sell agreements along with business and property licencing matters; and

  • Commercial and residential conveyancing, including sales of businesses.

\xa0

Applicants demonstrating experience across some, but not all practice areas are encouraged to apply.

\xa0

Who we are looking for

\xa0

Our ideal candidate is someone who truly values client relationships, enjoys a challenge and has strong business acumen. You should be thorough, timely and be motivated to take ownership of your work. Above all, we are looking for someone with a positive and professional demeanour, who enjoys working in a close-knit team.

\xa0

What we offer


Located in the heart of Hawthorn, we are a three-minute walk from train stations and a five minute drive to the Monash Freeway. We embrace an open-door policy and genuinely strive to preserve our synergistic firm culture. Our people are our assets which is why our firm encourages a work-life balance. We offer a sophisticated workspace, flexible work arrangements, excellent upskilling opportunities and career progression.

If the above sounds like you, we encourage you to apply. For further information, please don't hesitate to email us at info@madisonbranson.com.\xa0


Please note that, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 23 views

Job description

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Salesforce Solution Architect



At iSelect, we get that most people find insurance, utilities and personal finance boring. But we understand that it's really important to 'always get it right'. As Australia's 'Life Admin Store', we'll help you take care of the boring but important stuff. We provide Australians with the convenience of an online comparison and the benefit of telephone-based advice and sales across many product areas.

Our intuitive technology and highly trained staff help our customers to confidently compare and buy from hundreds of policies, plans and products. We operate in a growth-orientated, agile and progressive environment that fosters innovation and rewards success.


How you fit



The Salesforce Solution Architect builds a complete view of a solution for a project within a business domain (including, processes, information and information technology asset) from conception to implementation, ensuring that the solution meets the requirements and is aligned with the over-arching technology strategy and enterprise architecture guidelines/standards.\xa0


What you do


  • Develop and maintain target state solution architectures and roadmaps
  • Undertake high level research, horizon scanning and analysis to identify future ICT trends, and assess applicability
  • Maintain currency with industry best practice to ensure ICT solutions are fit for purpose
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders to align strategies with business needs
  • Oversee the technical direction, development, and implementation of SFDC software solutions


What you need


  • A proven functional/technical professional with multiple full lifecycle SFDC implementations and at least 3+ years of experience working with SFDC
  • Direct experience with SFDC Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Service Cloud (application design, architecture and development using Salesforce.com), certified a MAJOR PLUS
  • Excellent understanding of current architectural design patterns, standards, technologies and techniques
  • Strong SFDC knowledge and Integration components for SFDC (for example, SFDC APIs, Apex controllers, Apex Web Services, Apex callout, outbound messaging, SFDC data loaders and Tools - e.g. Mulesoft)
  • Demonstrated in-depth knowledge of leading edge technologies and plans for the future of a technology and/or applications area
  • Strong knowledge of AGILE/SCRUM Processes


What is in it for you


  • A competitive salary plus yearly incentive program
  • Individual and career development to help you succeed
  • The opportunity to work with a well-known, Australian household brand
  • 3 'recharge' days per year (yes, in addition to your Annual Leave!)
  • Performance driven, casual environment and most importantly a fun, engaged and energised workforce!
  • A free coffee each day, a funky caf\xe9 and work space

Leasing Executive

Company Name QIC Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 minutes ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

The opportunity


We currently have an 12 month maximum term, full time opportunity for an experienced retail Leasing Executive to join QIC’s Global Real Estateteam in Melbourne. At QIC, we adopt an investment style which is contemporary, sophisticated, disciplined and hands-on.


In this role you will bring your passion, enthusiasm and experience to this highly collaborative and successful team who have brought some of the best retail experiences toVictoria, Australia and abroad.


Working at our vibrant and established centres, where continued advancements and developments are happening, you will be required to provide a high-class service to our existing retail customersand leverage your existing networks to bring new clients to QIC within the aspirational and iconic retail platform.


You will be encouraged to bring new ideas to the team and cement transactions that help achieve our vision of a unique and multi-dimensional retail experience for our customers.


You will be well supported by one of the nation’s strongest tenancy design and delivery teams as well as a highly effective leasing admin team.


The ideal candidate


As a strong candidate for this role, you will have at least 5years’ experience within retail leasing, with previous asset project leasing experience and exceptional communication and negotiation skills. You will leverage your existing relationships to secure and service key retailer clients.


In addition, you will be able to demonstrate financial acumen and have a comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the relevant Retail Leases legislation. You will also have a current Real Estate Licence/Certificate of Registration or equivalent.


Why QIC & Global Real Estate


QIC is a global diversified alternative investment firm offering infrastructure, real estate, private equity, liquid strategies and multi-asset investments. It is one of the largest institutional investment managers in Australia, with A$86.1 billion (30 June 2018) in funds under management. QIC has over 1000 employees and serves more than 115 clients including governments, pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurers, spanning Australia, Europe, Asia, Middle East and the US. Headquartered in Brisbane, Australia, QIC also has offices in Sydney, Melbourne, New York, Los Angeles, Cleveland, Fort Lauderdale, San Francisco, London and Copenhagen.


At QIC our pursuit is to be an inclusive organisation, one in which every employee has a true voice. We want every employee to have a sense of belonging within QIC and this includes feeling like his or her difference is valued, whatever the difference. We want to build people leader capability to reduce unintended bias and ensure we are leveraging the uniqueness of all our people.


With approximately A$17.5 billion (30 June 2018) invested in Australian and international retail and commercial properties and a reputation for delivering predictable outcomes for clients over the long term, GRE’s team has specialist in-depth experience from deal origination and execution to asset management, leasing, marketing and development.


GRE originated in 1991 as part of QIC’s inception. Today, with professionals based in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Los Angeles and London, GRE is:



  • Consistently ranked as a top performing client-focused investment manager

  • A stable, long-standing, respected team with specialist depth of expertise.

  • Known for discipline, consistent returns and focus.


Apply now


To apply, please submit a cover letter and CV via our careers portal by3 October 2018.


Applications from Recruitment Agencies will not be considered.


Follow QIC on LinkedIn to receive the latest industry news and job updated athttps://www.linkedin.com/company/qic

  • Real Estate
  • Investment Management

Job Functions

  • Sales

Client Experience Manager

Company Name WorldStrides Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 46 views

Job description

Passionate about education and travel?\xa0


Eager to share your passion with teachers and educators?


About us


WorldStrides is dedicated to delivering educational travel experiences that fuel dreams for students of all ages. Our educational travel programs immerse students in knowledge culture and undeniable inspiration. WorldStrides has shaped the minds of students through educational travel since 1967 and each year over 400,000 students travel to more than 100 countries on our programs.


The role


We are looking for competitive and self-motivated sales professionals to represent a product that can change people's lives! The\xa0Client Experience Manager (CEM)\xa0is responsible for achieving sales goals through the sale of educational tours to Australian schools. Each CEM is required to maintain competitive sales numbers and will be responsible for finding prospective clients both within the existing databases and through additional activities.


Responsibilities


  • Solicit new clients and accounts through sales calls and follow up and convert potential sales leads
  • Maintain relationships with existing clients and accounts through the completion of the sale and efficiently respond to all inquiries made by potential clients via phone or email
  • Establish and maintain regular contact with clients and accounts in order to introduce and promote a destination or tour in accordance with company goals, marketing initiatives and sales expectations
  • Identify potential prospects to solicit new business and create a strong pipeline of future business leads
  • Develop a robust sales funnel of leads and prospects to achieve or exceed established sales goals
  • Ensure established monthly and seasonal sales goals are met or exceeded through self-motivation and determination
  • Maintain a detailed, organised and thorough database of teachers, including unqualified, qualified and active leads
  • Ensure CRM is up-to-date at all times
  • Manage and take responsibility for the entire sales process. Work with teachers to set enrolment deadlines for students, helps develop marketing strategies for the teachers to utilise while enrolling students. \xa0
  • Actively seek to develop and improve skills to build performance. Educate yourself on all related tours and WorldStrides products
  • Research and understand the educational travel industry and develop strategies to win business

\xa0

Additional Responsibilities:


  • Identify regional trends, competitive behaviour, promotional effectiveness, and market intelligence
  • Represent WorldStrides at trade association meetings and other related business events to promote all products and services.
  • Coordinates with department Director with the initiation of new marketing ideas and product development ideas


Requirements

  • A bachelor degree
  • 2-3 years progressive sales experience focusing on customer retention and new business acquisition
  • Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales quotas and measurable performance goals
  • Strong communication and presentation skills including the ability to work with all levels of employees and clients in a diplomatic and professional manner
  • The ability to build strong relationships externally and internally
  • The ability to deal with objections
  • Highly self-driven and motivated
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficient computer skills and the technical aptitude to master our CRM
  • Ability to multi-task projects and responsibilities and have strong prioritisation skills

\xa0

If this is the sales role you have been looking for, come make your mark on a growing and dynamic company. Qualified candidates should submit their cover letter and CV through LinkedIn.

Junior Network Systems Engineer

Company Name illion Australia and New Zealand Company Location 479 St Kilda Rd, Melbourne, VIC 3004, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 77 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A fantastic opportunity has become available for a Junior Network Systems Engineer to join our Infrastructure team to ensure the efficient operation of all facets of Network and Firewalls to meet the needs of the business as defined in our SLA's. The successful incumbent of the role will work with different internal stakeholders and external third parties. The role will also provide 24/7 on call support for escalated incidents.

You will be responsible for:

  • Provide first/ second level support for Infrastructure incidents and ensure service is restored promptly and effectively, whilst minimizing adverse effect on business operations;
  • Proactively identify, diagnose, document and eliminate IT infrastructure problems that cause or may cause system incidents;
  • Process IT Infrastructure service requests and manage logged service requests within agreed SLA timeframes;
  • Perform routine and adhoc administration and performance checks on infrastructure systems and data centre environments;
  • Test and implement system patches as required by release management plans;
  • Implement solutions into the IT environments.

\xa0

About You

The ideal candidate will have the following:\xa0

  • 2+ years experience in operational support;
  • Diploma or university degree in computer science or information technology and relevant work experience or industry experience;
  • Demonstrable experience managing large scale enterprise networks with over 1000 users;
  • knowledge of Windows 2008/12 server and TCP/IP networking, DHCP, DNS etc;
  • Operational experience with Web/Reverse Proxy Devices (Blue Coat);
  • Hands on experience with Web Application Firewalls (Imperva);

883709361:
[

Research Officer /Senior Research Officer

Company Name Australian Institute of Family Studies Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 360 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Research Officer or Senior Research Officer

APS 3-4 or APS 5-6

Full-time or part-time

Non-ongoing

\xa0

We are the Australian Institute of Family Studies, the Australian Government’s key independent research body and advisor in the area of family wellbeing, based in Melbourne. Our work increases understanding about the factors that help Australian families thrive, or that are barriers to their wellbeing. We produce research about ‘what works for families’ and make it accessible to decision makers, practitioners and the general public.

\xa0

The Australian Gambling Research Centre (AGRC) is situated within the Institute. We were established under the Commonwealth Gambling Measures Act 2012. The AGRC conducts research into gambling and related behaviours, provides independent advice, and communicates findings to policy-makers, academics, service providers, and the community.

\xa0

Our policy-relevant research enhances understanding of the nature and extent of gambling participation, and gambling-related harm in Australia. By doing this the AGRC seeks to advance knowledge of ways to prevent and reduce gambling-related harm among at-risk populations, their families and communities.

\xa0

Are you keen to put your strong research experience and technical skills to work in an organisation committed to having a social impact? This role is for you if you have a track record in qualitative and/or quantitative research methodologies including conducting fieldwork, data management and analysis, paired with excellent project management skills.

\xa0

You will be working as part of a team to successfully execute a number of research projects within the AGRC and help to ensure that research output is communicated in a way that is accessible to the intended audience (for example, policy makers, academics and the general public). Key duties include: synthesising and critiquing existing research; assisting with the design, data collection and analysis components of research projects; communicating findings through the writing and preparation of publications and presentations; and liaising with government agencies, community organisations and research participants. Working collaboratively within and between teams towards the realisation of shared goals is an integral aspect of these roles.

\xa0

We are seeking two experienced Research Officers (full-time or part-time) or Senior Research Officers (full-time or part-time) to join the AGRC. The roles are offered on a non-ongoing basis for a period of 12 months at APS Level 3–4 with a salary range of $57,026 to $69,008 per annum (full-time equivalent) for the Research Officer and APS Level 5–6 with a salary range of $71,357 to $87,948 per annum (full-time equivalent) for the Senior Research Officer.

\xa0

How to apply for these jobs

Download a full Position Description at https://aifs.gov.au/about-us/working-aifs/jobs. \xa0

Please email your AIFS application form, CV and covering letter to jobs@aifs.gov.au.

Applications close Sunday 14 October 2018.

For further information, contact Human Resources on (03) 9214 7888.

The Institute welcomes applications from the diverse Australian community including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people with disability, people of all ages and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

\xa0

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 121 views

Job description

Tetra Pak Australia have an exciting opportunity for a Pre Projects Engineer to join our fast paced and dynamic business within our pre projects team. The team are currently busy working on multiple large-scale projects supporting the growth of our customers across Oceania. Current projects include evaporation and drying, membrane, cheese manufacture, and UHT processes.

\xa0

The purpose of this role is to prepare proposals for engineered systems, the management and production of proposals, liaising closely with our customers and internally with key stakeholders and ensuring the pre process stage is seamless.


Key Responsibilities will include:

  • Seeking and managing additional resources as required to meet pre-project commitments.
  • \xa0 Reviewing information and ensure output is meeting the clients’ requirements and make changes as necessary after consultation
  • \xa0Assisting in developing sales and marketing strategy to maximize potential for success of bid/s.
  • Separating wants from needs so that proposal is best targeted to meet clients’ requirement.
  • Reviewing clients production needs relative to equipment size alternatives and utilization.
  • Optimizing equipment selection available from Tetra Pak’s internal supply and other external suppliers.
  • Reviewing risks, margin and sales strategy with key account manager and processing team
  • Prepare pricing
  • Prepare technical specifications for quotation
  • Prepare contract details for specification
  • Present proposals
  • Support to other projects as required

\xa0

The ideal candidate will have tertiary qualification either Chemical or Mechanical Engineering and food sciences and have relevant experience in the liquid food processing industry, preferably in the dairy, juice or soft drink segments. You will have excellent project management skills and be able to work autonomously with previous experience in developing production solutions; control liquid food processes; writing functional specifications; sizing flow elements such as pumps, valves and lines and process design, implementation and commissioning.

\xa0

Travel is an integral part of this role, hence flexibility is a pre-requisite.

In return, we are offering a competitive salary with attractive benefits and long term career opportunities in a friendly and collaborative work environment.


If you are interested in joining a multinational organization, with exceptional career opportunities, apply directly via the Careers section on the Tetra Pak global website www.tetrapak.com/about-tetra-pak/career.


We look forward to reviewing your resume and covering letter addressing the essential criteria listed above.

\xa0

Applications Close: 15 October 2018

Job Details
  • Work on nbn's FTTC design and construction project, vehicle provided

The Role

Service Stream's network construction operations team are seeking a Project Construction Supervisor to provide supervision of telecommunications network construction subcontractors and ensure that field activities are completed in a safe, time efficient and high quality manner. Reporting to the Project Engineer, this position is offered on a full-time, 12 month contract basis, and is based from our Clayton South office, although the position requires substantial time in the field. This role will predominantly focus on fibre to the curb nbn works.

Key Responsibilities
  • Manage the day to day activity of field work, staff, equipment and materials to ensure that the performance of field work occurs in accordance with agreed schedules
  • Establish and maintain a consistently safe working environment in accordance with HSE requirements
  • Ensure the standard of all work in the field is of a high quality and in accordance with work practices and standards required by the Client, the Company and service providers

To be successful in this position, you will have substantial experience in managing field construction work in the fixed telecommunications industry, including management of a subcontractor workforce. Engineering Manager

Company Name Altitude - Information & Communication Technology Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 21 minutes ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Altitude is looking for an Electronics Engineering Manager for a permanent position in Melbourne.


  • Electronics Hardware Engineering Manager
  • Permanent position in Melbourne, South Eastern suburbs
  • Electronic design and Manufacturing ASX listed company



THE ROLE:
A new position is now open for a R&D Engineering Manager - Electronics. As the leader of the hardware engineering team, you will be involved in overseeing all aspects of the electronic product development including; scope, architecture, design and implementation.
\xa0 \xa0
This role requires an experienced manager with a background in electronics who enjoys both the technical and managerial challenges in bringing a product to market. You will a lead a team of electronic engineers and drive the design process and outputs to a successful outcome.
\xa0\xa0


REQUIREMENTS:
You will have proven experience in embedded electronic design and processes to bring a quality product to market and will have held a senior engineering management role previously. As a result you will be responsible for the performance management of small teams, conducting performance reviews, KPI setting and measuring. Furthermore this management role will involve recruitment of staff, therefore experience in recruitment and mentoring are essential.


  • Extensive exposure and experience in embedded electronic design, from concept to design, implementation, production and support
  • Defining and documenting requirements, specifications, tenders, RFI's and proposals
  • Proven use of design processes to ensure quality and reliable designs that meet specification and intended markets
  • Clear understanding on Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA)
  • Product compliance - EMC/ESD/FCC etc
  • Planning and scheduling team tasks efficiently and to successful outcomes, demonstrate on time delivery and reporting
  • Proven experience in electronic circuit design (preferred experience in Altium).



HOW TO APPLY:
Please apply here and call Damian on 03 8609 1228 for a chat.
\xa0
Altitude is an equal opportunity employer that actively embraces diversity in its workforce through accurate community representation of gender, culture; thought and work arrangements.

Business Development Manager

Company Name Beon Energy Solutions Company Location 40 Market St, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Beon Energy Solutions:

\xa0

We’re a future-focused energy solutions business with a heritage in safety, quality, performance and reliability, and a commitment to become much more. We bring technical expertise and agility to provide energy solutions in utility and infrastructure, commercial and industrial, and residential projects across Australia.

\xa0

Our team of dedicated energy experts have a desire to drive and embrace change.

\xa0

About the Role:

\xa0

This position of Business Development Manager is focused on business development, execution, and business integration. It will work collaboratively to help identify value enhancing organic growth opportunities supplemented as necessary through targeted strategic acquisitions and lead generation.

\xa0

Demonstrated business development experience within the areas of electricity network infrastructure, renewable generation projects such as solar, wind and associated new technology such as batteries. Other focus areas include transport and maintenance (non-renewables)

\xa0

Business Development Manager

\xa0

  • Develop, manage and cultivate strong relationships with key clients.

  • Create and lead client business opportunities with a strong focus towards D&C, or EPC and \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 O&M contracts, and asset ownership.

  • Contribute to business growth and margin targets achieved by meeting customer and business expectations.

  • Lead and manage project developments throughout the client life cycle, particularly within the utility scale renewable generation, transport and transmission and distribution sectors.

  • Partner with key internal and external stakeholders to maximise targeted customer relationships and influence asset investment as well as involvement with new energy areas such as battery deployment

  • Contribute to and influence the strategic planning framework for Energy Solutions.

  • Establish and develop the strategy with relevant key stake holders to win individual opportunities based on the key client requirements.

  • Lead multidisciplinary cross functional teams required for successful proposal development.

  • Contribute to a workplace culture that is focused on positive work place improvement and \xa0 developing bet practice services that enables business development opportunities

\xa0

Required skills and experience:

\xa0

Relevant years’ experience in business or project development, preferably leading and riving \xa0 opportunities through from strategy initiation through to contract signing and beyond

Experience of the energy/electricity sectors, or exposure to other related capital intensive environments such as mining, infrastructure and construction would be desirable

\xa0

Your career with Beon Energy Solutions:


If you possess the required skills and experience and you are looking for a fantastic career opportunity please submit your application by COB Friday 12 October 2018
